title: Observability Gradient in Nominative Determinism
hypothesis: Narrative effects decrease as observability increases

gradient.description: Performance hidden - Valuations are speculative, fundamentals unclear
gradient.mechanism: Names create perception in absence of objective metrics
gradient.example: Coins with serious names outperform meme names by 65%

gradient.description: Performance partially hidden - Threat severity ambiguous before landfall
gradient.mechanism: Severe names trigger more precautions, reducing deaths
gradient.example: Hurricane Katrina vs Hurricane Ophelia - name severity affects response

gradient.description: Performance partially observable - Metrics exist but incomplete
gradient.mechanism: Names affect fundraising and early perception before traction
gradient.example: Airbnb vs CouchSurfing - professional name enables VC funding

gradient.description: Performance fully observable - Safety records are public facts
gradient.mechanism: No mechanism - engineering quality determines outcomes
gradient.example: Airport codes assigned by IATA, airline safety tracked publicly

aviation_role: High-observability control domain validating NULL hypothesis
scientific_value: Proves narrative effects are NOT universal but context-dependent

aviation_results.interpretation: NULL result as predicted by theory
